events.event_description: Annual U.S. biodiesel imports doubled to 33,000 barrels per day from 2022 to 2023 as European suppliers sought higher prices in the U.S. market.
events.citation: Annual U.S. biodiesel imports doubled from 2022 to 2023 to 33,000 barrels per day (b/d) and continued to rise in the first two months of 2024, according to the most recent data available.

events.event_description: U.S. biodiesel imports reached 54,000 barrels per day in February 2024, the highest monthly level since June 2017.
events.citation: In February 2024, the United States imported 54,000 b/d of biodiesel, the most for any month since June 2017.

events.event_description: Sweden announced significant reduction in required biofuel share in diesel from 30.5% to 6.0% for 2024-2026 due to high inflation.
events.citation: In 2023, Sweden announced it would reduce the required share of biofuels in diesel for 2024–26 from 30.5% to 6.0%.

events.event_description: U.S. Department of Commerce initiated trade investigations resulting in duties on biodiesel imports from Argentina and Indonesia.
events.citation: U.S. Department of Commerce and International Trade Commission initiated trade investigations in April 2017 that resulted in antidumping duty and countervailing duty orders that put duties on biodiesel imports from these countries to offset the effects of the subsidies.

events.event_description: Archer-Daniels-Midland (ADM) became the primary importer of record for U.S. biodiesel imports, controlling all imports from Germany through its Hamburg terminal.
events.citation: ADM has been the importer of record for most of the U.S. biodiesel imports since November 2022, including all the biodiesel from Germany. ADM owns an export terminal in Hamburg, Germany, connected to its oil-seed processing plant, which is Europe's largest.

events.event_description: U.S. biodiesel production increased by 5% in 2023 despite growing imports and competition from renewable diesel.
events.citation: Despite growing imports and increased competition from the production of renewable diesel, U.S. biodiesel production increased by 5% in 2023 from 2022.
